title.narrative: ENV- Climate Resilient Community Conservancies Activity

description.narrative: (Kenya): The Biodiversity Conservation and Livelihood Improvement by Community Conservancies in the Maasai Mara Region activity supports community driven sustainable biodiversity conservation and improves livelihoods in the Maasai Mara landscape in Kenya. The purpose of the activity is to: establish integrated and sustainable conservancy leadership and governance structures for community and privately managed conservancies; establish a mixed-model conservancy approach supporting improved landscape management, better wildlife security by securing critical wildlife migratory corridors, combating wildlife crime, and increasing economic opportunities and household income for landowners through establishment of a cattle enterprise; and strengthen Maasai Mara Wildlife Conservancies Association's (MMWCA) organizational systems and capacities to build effectiveness and accountability into constituent member conservancies, landowners, private sector, and development partners. FY 2018 funds will focus on upscaling and sustaining MMWCA's activities to achieve higher level results and long-term outcomes in the landscape. The activities will include: improving MMWCA's coordination capacity to support leadership and governance structures, assessing and strengthening MMWCA's organizational capacities as a membership body to coordinate community conservancies, and leveraging additional resources for sustainability. The program supports U.S. government security priorities, by countering illegal wildlife poaching and trafficking, as criminal activities have been known to help fund terrorist groups. This activity supports the U.S. National Strategy for Combating Wildlife Trafficking, the Eliminate, Neutralize, and Disrupt Wildlife Trafficking Act, and USAID's self-reliance agenda by helping Kenya's conservancies manage and plan for better conservancy governance systems, which in turn will help solve Kenya's development challenges in conservancy/wildlife sector.
